intro: Seriphidium santolinum, commonly known as the Santolinum wormwood, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, gray-green foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Seriphidium santolinum is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
